page.title: 14W.I.
page.content: {RUYTON XI TOWN'S {WOMEN'S INSTITUTE was founded in 1920. The first meeting took place on 8th September,1920 in the School, Miss Eliza Kenyon being in the chair There were 36 members at this meeting, a year later this had gone up to 55. The subsciption was 2 shillings and meetings were held monthly. {1985} The meetings are still held monthly but now the subscription is Â£4.The meetings are now held in the Memorial Institute, paid-up members number 20. After business there is a talk or demonstration. This year they have been on Cookery, Pollution,the Handicapped Child,Iridology herbulism, a cartoonist,English cheeses, Wood Carving, Aroma Therapy, The America we saw and country dancing.
